alert.note: Alert for Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: High Wind Warning issued December 17 at 3:24AM MST until December 19 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST THIS MORNING... ...HIGH WIND WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 5 AM SATURDAY TO 5 PM MST SUNDAY... * WHAT...West winds 35 to 50 MPH with gusts up to 75 MPH possible. * WHERE...Central Laramie Range including Bordeaux along Interstate 25 between Chugwater and Wheatland. * WHEN...Two periods of strong winds, the first ending at 11 AM MST this morning. A second and more prolonged period of strong winds will occur from 5 AM MST Saturday through at least 5 PM MST Sunday. The strongest winds are expected from late Saturday through early Sunday. * IMPACTS...Mainly to transportation. Strong cross winds will be hazardous to light weight and high profile vehicles, including campers and tractor trailers. There will be a high risk for vehicle blow overs, particularly along north to south oriented roadways.
info.instruction: A High Wind Warning means a hazardous high wind event is expected or occurring. Sustained wind speeds of at least 40 mph or gusts of 58 mph or more can lead to property damage.

area.areaDesc: Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County
